result.execSummary:
The defendant Kieren L Finch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay stipulated amount of $1,600.00 to the victim, Sarah Mae J.

Case adjourned to 09-24-15 at 8:30am for Rest. Hearing as to contested amount of restitution.

Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges including the DNA and restitution surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a conviction felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restoed.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
- No Contact with the victims.
- No Contact with Walgreens.
- Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and folow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court.  Defendant, Kieren L Finch, not in court.  Defendant in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter is here for a Restitution Hearing.  The State requested that restitution be set at zero.  No objection from the Defense.  The Court ORDERED restitution set at zero.  No future court dates.
COPY of Video Conference Technician's email to the clerk stating video is not available until 10:30 AM on 09--24-2015; filed.

Defendant Kieren L Finch in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kieren L Finch in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for 143 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with Walgreens.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the "stipulated" amount of $1,600.00 payable to the victim, Sarah Mae J.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 09-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Restitution Hearing as to the contested amount of restitution for the $500.00 deductible as to victim, Sarah Mae J.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
(2) Crime Victim Impact Statements with attached Restitution Worksheets.
Sentencing Paperwork.

Defendant Kieren L Finch in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kieren L Finch in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Kieren L Finch not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Kieren L Finch not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.
Case adjourned to 06-01-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Kieren L Finch not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request another scheduling conference date.
Case adjourned to 05-04-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Kieren L Finch in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kieren L Finch in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Tony Castro. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Walgreens - 5201 N 91st Street, Milwaukee,WI
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kieren L Finch in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kieren L Finch in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
